thread.title: Alexis Sanchez caught speeding by police who then ‘confiscate his licence and give him April court date’
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez caught speeding by police who then ‘confiscate his licence and give him April court date’

author: smorgan
title: Alexis Sanchez caught speeding by police who then ‘confiscate his licence and give him April court date’
text:
Speedy Gonzalez Alexis Sanchez caught speeding by police who then ‘confiscate his licence and give him April court date’ 
Arsenal striker was reportedly travelling at 96mph in a 75mph limit when he was stopped in Chile By Sam Morgan 26th March 2017, 5:45 pm Updated: 27th March 2017, 1:10 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ALEXIS SANCHEZ has reportedly been fined, had his licence confiscated and been given a court date after being caught speeding in Chile. 
The Arsenal striker, on international duty in his homeland, was doing 96mph in a 75mph zone on a motorway in capital city Santiago. Getty Images 5 Alexis Sanchez was caught speeding in Chile 
Reports claim Sanchez was clocked by cops yesterday and an image of what is thought to be his ticket is circulating online. 
According to AS, Sanchez has now been given an April 12 court date in Buin, just south of Santiago. 
That comes just two days after Crystal Palace host Arsene Wenger’s side in the Premier League. 24Horas This photo shows Alexis Sanchez’s confiscated driving licence 24Horas This photo purports to show the speeding ticket that Alexis Sanchez was issued Getty Images Alexis Sanchez still made it to Chile training after the incident Getty Images The Arsenal striker was all smiles despite his run-in with police Arsene Wenger and Alexis Sanchez - Is the Arsenal love story over? Most read in football Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe Seeing Red Keith Gillespie launches viscous elbow into face of opponent during Man United charity match 'I don't even like football' Neil Taylor is hammered on Twitter after breaking Seamus Coleman’s leg… but it’s an ex-councillor not the Wales defender taking the brunt of the abuse 
Chile boss Juan Antonio Pizzi had given his players the day off training ahead of their World Cup qualifier against Venezuela on Tuesday. 
Sanchez was all smiles when the team got together again today for final preparations ahead of the game. 
But his brush-in with the law is the latest blow for Sanchez, who has been accused of upsetting team-mates by throwing a tantrum following the defeat to Argentina . Arsenal star Alexis Sanchez scores header after 22-pass move
